byline.original: By LIZ ROBBINS and ALISON LEIGH COWAN

abstract: Brooklyn Borough President Marty Markowitz’s network of nonprofit groups have received large donations from corporations and developers with pending Brooklyn projects; Markowitz has raised at least $20 million since 2003, and probably more, for his charities; that remarkable amount is a testament to his stature as a Brooklyn power broker and to his intense focus on building these nonprofit groups; they in turn play an important role in burnishing his public profile.
